trans-unit.source: Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services
trans-unit.target: Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services

trans-unit.source: The topic shows how to create an X12 agreement in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: The topic shows how to create an X12 agreement in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Create an X12 Agreement
trans-unit.target: Create an X12 Agreement

trans-unit.source: To create an X12 agreement between two trading partners, enter the partners and their identities.
trans-unit.target: To create an X12 agreement between two trading partners, enter the partners and their identities.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, select <ui>Agreements</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, select <ui>Agreements</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the Agreements page, select the <ui>EDI</ui> tab, and then select <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the Agreements page, select the <ui>EDI</ui> tab, and then select <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>New Agreement</ui> page, enter the following:
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>New Agreement</ui> page, enter the following:

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Protocol
trans-unit.target: Protocol

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>X12</embeddedLabel> for X12 agreements.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>X12</embeddedLabel> for X12 agreements.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Enter notes or a description of the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Enter notes or a description of the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Hosted Partner
trans-unit.target: Hosted Partner

trans-unit.source: Select the hosted partner for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Select the hosted partner for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Hosted partner is the partner that <token>af_integration</token> deploys the X12 send and receive pipelines.
trans-unit.target: Hosted partner is the partner that <token>af_integration</token> deploys the X12 send and receive pipelines.

trans-unit.source: Guest Partner
trans-unit.target: Guest Partner

trans-unit.source: Select the partner for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Select the partner for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: A guest partner is the partner that the hosted partner wants to use B2B messaging.
trans-unit.target: A guest partner is the partner that the hosted partner wants to use B2B messaging.

trans-unit.source: Identities
trans-unit.target: Identities

trans-unit.source: Hosted Partner Qualifier
trans-unit.target: Hosted Partner Qualifier

trans-unit.source: Select the business identity qualifier that provides unique business identities to the trading partners.
trans-unit.target: Select the business identity qualifier that provides unique business identities to the trading partners.

trans-unit.source: Trading partners can opt for a mutually agreed business identity.
trans-unit.target: Trading partners can opt for a mutually agreed business identity.

trans-unit.source: Hosted Partner Value
trans-unit.target: Hosted Partner Value

trans-unit.source: Enter the value for the hosted partner qualifier.
trans-unit.target: Enter the value for the hosted partner qualifier.

trans-unit.source: Guest Partner Qualifier
trans-unit.target: Guest Partner Qualifier

trans-unit.source: Select an business identity qualifier that provides unique business identities to the trading partners.
trans-unit.target: Select an business identity qualifier that provides unique business identities to the trading partners.

trans-unit.source: Trading partners can opt for a mutually agreed business identity.
trans-unit.target: Trading partners can opt for a mutually agreed business identity.

trans-unit.source: Guest Partner Value
trans-unit.target: Guest Partner Value

trans-unit.source: Enter the value for the guest partner qualifier.
trans-unit.target: Enter the value for the guest partner qualifier.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Continue</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Continue</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Receive Settings</ui> and <ui>Send Settings</ui> tabs are added.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Receive Settings</ui> and <ui>Send Settings</ui> tabs are added.

trans-unit.source: Each tab is to create a one-way agreement between the two partners: one to receive messages and another for sending messages.
trans-unit.target: Each tab is to create a one-way agreement between the two partners: one to receive messages and another for sending messages.

trans-unit.source: Configure the X12 Receive settings
trans-unit.target: Configure the X12 Receive settings

trans-unit.source: The receive settings for an X12 agreement primarily include the X12 protocol settings.
trans-unit.target: The receive settings for an X12 agreement primarily include the X12 protocol settings.

trans-unit.source: These settings are used when receiving an X12 message from a trading partner.
trans-unit.target: These settings are used when receiving an X12 message from a trading partner.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab is displayed only after you entered the <embeddedLabel>General Settings</embeddedLabel> for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab is displayed only after you entered the <embeddedLabel>General Settings</embeddedLabel> for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <token>tpm_portal</token> to receive messages from a trading partner and send back an acknowledgement.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <token>tpm_portal</token> to receive messages from a trading partner and send back an acknowledgement.

trans-unit.source: To send an acknowledgement in response to a message:
trans-unit.target: To send an acknowledgement in response to a message:

trans-unit.source: Select the option to generate technical and functional acknowledgements from the <legacyBold>Protocol</legacyBold> page on the <legacyBold>Receive Settings</legacyBold> tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the option to generate technical and functional acknowledgements from the <legacyBold>Protocol</legacyBold> page on the <legacyBold>Receive Settings</legacyBold> tab.

trans-unit.source: By doing this, you declare that the party which sent the interchange expects an acknowledgement.
trans-unit.target: By doing this, you declare that the party which sent the interchange expects an acknowledgement.

trans-unit.source: If the acknowledgement needs to be sent back with specific properties set, such as CR LF enabled, separator characters to be different, and so on, then set those properties.
trans-unit.target: If the acknowledgement needs to be sent back with specific properties set, such as CR LF enabled, separator characters to be different, and so on, then set those properties.

trans-unit.source: You can configure this from the <embeddedLabel>Advanced Settings</embeddedLabel> section of the <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel> page of the <ui>Send Settings</ui> tab.
trans-unit.target: You can configure this from the <embeddedLabel>Advanced Settings</embeddedLabel> section of the <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel> page of the <ui>Send Settings</ui> tab.

trans-unit.source: By doing this, you configure how the party sends back the acknowledgement.
trans-unit.target: By doing this, you configure how the party sends back the acknowledgement.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Protocol</ui> page, you enter the protocol settings between the two partners.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Protocol</ui> page, you enter the protocol settings between the two partners.

trans-unit.source: These can be divided into Basic and Advanced Settings.
trans-unit.target: These can be divided into Basic and Advanced Settings.

trans-unit.source: Basic Settings
trans-unit.target: Basic Settings

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Identifiers
trans-unit.target: Identifiers

trans-unit.source: ISA1 (Authorization Qualifier)
trans-unit.target: ISA1 (Authorization Qualifier)

trans-unit.source: Select the Authorization qualifier value from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Select the Authorization qualifier value from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: ISA2
trans-unit.target: ISA2

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Enter Authorization information value.
trans-unit.target: Enter Authorization information value.

trans-unit.source: If the value you entered for ISA1 is other than 00, enter a minimum of one alphanumeric character and a maximum of 10.
trans-unit.target: If the value you entered for ISA1 is other than 00, enter a minimum of one alphanumeric character and a maximum of 10.

trans-unit.source: ISA3 (Security Qualifier)
trans-unit.target: ISA3 (Security Qualifier)

trans-unit.source: Select the Security qualifier value from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Select the Security qualifier value from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: ISA4
trans-unit.target: ISA4

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Security information value.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Security information value.

trans-unit.source: If the value you entered for ISA3 is other than 00, enter a minimum of one alphanumeric character and a maximum of 10.
trans-unit.target: If the value you entered for ISA3 is other than 00, enter a minimum of one alphanumeric character and a maximum of 10.

trans-unit.source: Acknowledgements
trans-unit.target: Acknowledgements

trans-unit.source: TA1 expected
trans-unit.target: TA1 expected

trans-unit.source: Select this checkbox to return a technical (TA1) acknowledgment to the interchange sender.
trans-unit.target: Select this checkbox to return a technical (TA1) acknowledgment to the interchange sender.

trans-unit.source: These acknowledgments are sent to the interchange sender based on the Send Settings for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: These acknowledgments are sent to the interchange sender based on the Send Settings for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: FA expected
trans-unit.target: FA expected

trans-unit.source: Select this checkbox to return a functional (FA) acknowledgment to the interchange sender.
trans-unit.target: Select this checkbox to return a functional (FA) acknowledgment to the interchange sender.

trans-unit.source: Then select whether you want the 997 or 999 acknowledgements, based on the schema versions you are working with.
trans-unit.target: Then select whether you want the 997 or 999 acknowledgements, based on the schema versions you are working with.

trans-unit.source: These acknowledgments are sent to the interchange sender based on the Send Settings for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: These acknowledgments are sent to the interchange sender based on the Send Settings for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Include AK2/IK2 Loop
trans-unit.target: Include AK2/IK2 Loop

trans-unit.source: Select this checkbox to enable generation of AK2 loops in functional acknowledgments for accepted transaction sets.
trans-unit.target: Select this checkbox to enable generation of AK2 loops in functional acknowledgments for accepted transaction sets.

trans-unit.source: This checkbox is enabled only if you selected the <embeddedLabel>FA expected</embeddedLabel> checkbox.
trans-unit.target: This checkbox is enabled only if you selected the <embeddedLabel>FA expected</embeddedLabel> checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Schemas
trans-unit.target: Schemas

trans-unit.source: Choose a schema for each transaction type (ST1) and Sender Application (GS2).
trans-unit.target: Choose a schema for each transaction type (ST1) and Sender Application (GS2).

trans-unit.source: The receive pipeline disassembles the incoming message by matching the values for ST1 and GS2 in the incoming message with the values you set here, and the schema of the incoming message with the schema you set here.
trans-unit.target: The receive pipeline disassembles the incoming message by matching the values for ST1 and GS2 in the incoming message with the values you set here, and the schema of the incoming message with the schema you set here.

trans-unit.source: To upload a schema:
trans-unit.target: To upload a schema:

trans-unit.source: Select the <ui>Upload</ui> button.
trans-unit.target: Select the <ui>Upload</ui> button.

trans-unit.source: In the Open dialog box, select the schema to use in the agreement, and select <ui>Open</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the Open dialog box, select the schema to use in the agreement, and select <ui>Open</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Common B2B Schemas are available to download at <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=235057</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=235057</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Common B2B Schemas are available to download at <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=235057</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=235057</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Once the schema is uploaded, you can specify the ST1 and GS2 details.
trans-unit.target: Once the schema is uploaded, you can specify the ST1 and GS2 details.

trans-unit.source: The Receive pipeline is now be able to disassemble any message that conforms to the selected schema.
trans-unit.target: The Receive pipeline is now be able to disassemble any message that conforms to the selected schema.

trans-unit.source: Advanced Settings
trans-unit.target: Advanced Settings

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Control Numbers
trans-unit.target: Control Numbers

trans-unit.source: Disallow Interchange Control Number duplicates
trans-unit.target: Disallow Interchange Control Number duplicates

trans-unit.source: Check this option to block duplicate interchanges.
trans-unit.target: Check this option to block duplicate interchanges.

trans-unit.source: If selected, the BizTalk Services Portal checks that the interchange control number (ISA13) for the received interchange does not match the interchange control number.
trans-unit.target: If selected, the BizTalk Services Portal checks that the interchange control number (ISA13) for the received interchange does not match the interchange control number.

trans-unit.source: If a match is detected, the receive pipeline does not process the interchange.
trans-unit.target: If a match is detected, the receive pipeline does not process the interchange.

trans-unit.source: If you opted to disallow duplicate interchange control numbers, then you can specify the number of days at which the check is performed by giving the appropriate value for <embeddedLabel>Check for duplicate ISA13 every x days</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: If you opted to disallow duplicate interchange control numbers, then you can specify the number of days at which the check is performed by giving the appropriate value for <embeddedLabel>Check for duplicate ISA13 every x days</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Disallow Group control number duplicates
trans-unit.target: Disallow Group control number duplicates

trans-unit.source: Check this option to block interchanges with duplicate group control numbers.
trans-unit.target: Check this option to block interchanges with duplicate group control numbers.

trans-unit.source: Disallow Transaction set control number duplicates
trans-unit.target: Disallow Transaction set control number duplicates

trans-unit.source: Check this option to block interchanges with duplicate transaction set control numbers.
trans-unit.target: Check this option to block interchanges with duplicate transaction set control numbers.

trans-unit.source: Validation
trans-unit.target: Validation

trans-unit.source: Message Type
trans-unit.target: Message Type

trans-unit.source: EDI Message type, like <legacyItalic>850-Purchase Order</legacyItalic> or <legacyItalic>999-Implementation Acknowledgement</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: EDI Message type, like <legacyItalic>850-Purchase Order</legacyItalic> or <legacyItalic>999-Implementation Acknowledgement</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: EDI Validation
trans-unit.target: EDI Validation

trans-unit.source: Performs EDI validation on data types as defined by the EDI properties of the schema, length restrictions, empty data elements, and trailing separators.
trans-unit.target: Performs EDI validation on data types as defined by the EDI properties of the schema, length restrictions, empty data elements, and trailing separators.

trans-unit.source: Extended Validation
trans-unit.target: Extended Validation

trans-unit.source: If the data type is not EDI, validation is on the data element requirement and allowed repetition, enumerations, and data element length validation (min/max).
trans-unit.target: If the data type is not EDI, validation is on the data element requirement and allowed repetition, enumerations, and data element length validation (min/max).

trans-unit.source: Allow Leading/Trailing Zeroes
trans-unit.target: Allow Leading/Trailing Zeroes

trans-unit.source: Any additional space and zero characters that are leading or trailing are retained.
trans-unit.target: Any additional space and zero characters that are leading or trailing are retained.

trans-unit.source: They are not removed.
trans-unit.target: They are not removed.

trans-unit.source: Trailing Separator Policy
trans-unit.target: Trailing Separator Policy

trans-unit.source: Generates trailing separators on the interchange received.
trans-unit.target: Generates trailing separators on the interchange received.

trans-unit.source: Options include <embeddedLabel>NotAllowed</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Optional</embeddedLabel>, and <embeddedLabel>Mandatory</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Options include <embeddedLabel>NotAllowed</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Optional</embeddedLabel>, and <embeddedLabel>Mandatory</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Internal Settings
trans-unit.target: Internal Settings

trans-unit.source: Convert implied decimal format Nn to base 10 numeric value
trans-unit.target: Convert implied decimal format Nn to base 10 numeric value

trans-unit.source: Converts an EDI number that is specified with the format Nn into a base-10 numeric value in the intermediate XML in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: Converts an EDI number that is specified with the format Nn into a base-10 numeric value in the intermediate XML in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: Create empty XML tags if trailing separators are allowed
trans-unit.target: Create empty XML tags if trailing separators are allowed

trans-unit.source: Select this check box to have the interchange sender include empty XML tags for trailing separators.
trans-unit.target: Select this check box to have the interchange sender include empty XML tags for trailing separators.

trans-unit.source: Inbound batching processing
trans-unit.target: Inbound batching processing

trans-unit.source: Options include:
trans-unit.target: Options include:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Split Interchange as transaction sets - suspend transaction sets on error</embeddedLabel>: Parses each transaction set in an interchange into a separate XML document by applying the appropriate envelope to the transaction set.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Split Interchange as transaction sets - suspend transaction sets on error</embeddedLabel>: Parses each transaction set in an interchange into a separate XML document by applying the appropriate envelope to the transaction set.

trans-unit.source: With this option, if one or more transaction sets in the interchange fail validation, then <token>af_integration</token> suspends only those transaction sets.
trans-unit.target: With this option, if one or more transaction sets in the interchange fail validation, then <token>af_integration</token> suspends only those transaction sets.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Split Interchange as transaction sets - suspend interchange on error</embeddedLabel>: Parses each transaction set in an interchange into a separate XML document by applying the appropriate envelope.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Split Interchange as transaction sets - suspend interchange on error</embeddedLabel>: Parses each transaction set in an interchange into a separate XML document by applying the appropriate envelope.

trans-unit.source: With this option, if one or more transaction sets in the interchange fail validation, then <token>af_integration</token> suspends the entire interchange.
trans-unit.target: With this option, if one or more transaction sets in the interchange fail validation, then <token>af_integration</token> suspends the entire interchange.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Preserve Interchange - suspend transaction sets on error</embeddedLabel>: Leaves the interchange intact, creating an XML document for the entire batched interchange.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Preserve Interchange - suspend transaction sets on error</embeddedLabel>: Leaves the interchange intact, creating an XML document for the entire batched interchange.

trans-unit.source: With this option, if onAe or more transaction sets in the interchange fail validation, then <token>af_integration</token> suspends only those transaction sets, while continuing to process all other transaction sets.
trans-unit.target: With this option, if onAe or more transaction sets in the interchange fail validation, then <token>af_integration</token> suspends only those transaction sets, while continuing to process all other transaction sets.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Preserve Interchange - suspend interchange on error</embeddedLabel>: Leaves the interchange intact, creating an XML document for the entire batched interchange.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Preserve Interchange - suspend interchange on error</embeddedLabel>: Leaves the interchange intact, creating an XML document for the entire batched interchange.

trans-unit.source: With this option, if one or more transaction sets in the interchange fail validation, then <token>af_integration</token> suspends the entire interchange.
trans-unit.target: With this option, if one or more transaction sets in the interchange fail validation, then <token>af_integration</token> suspends the entire interchange.

trans-unit.source: Configure the X12 Send settings
trans-unit.target: Configure the X12 Send settings

trans-unit.source: The X12 send settings specify the agreement configuration for sending messages to trading partners, including batching and protocol settings.
trans-unit.target: The X12 send settings specify the agreement configuration for sending messages to trading partners, including batching and protocol settings.

trans-unit.source: This section lists the steps to configure the send-side settings of an X12 agreement.
trans-unit.target: This section lists the steps to configure the send-side settings of an X12 agreement.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab is displayed only after you have specified the <embeddedLabel>General Settings</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab is displayed only after you have specified the <embeddedLabel>General Settings</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Add a Batch
trans-unit.target: Add a Batch

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Batching</ui> page on the <ui>Send Settings</ui> tab allows you to create batches to send several messages as a batch to a partner.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Batching</ui> page on the <ui>Send Settings</ui> tab allows you to create batches to send several messages as a batch to a partner.

trans-unit.source: You can also enter rules based on which a batch is triggered.
trans-unit.target: You can also enter rules based on which a batch is triggered.

trans-unit.source: These rules are based on the values of promoted properties you defined in the earlier stages.
trans-unit.target: These rules are based on the values of promoted properties you defined in the earlier stages.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Batching</ui> page, select <ui>Add Batch</ui> to launch a wizard.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Batching</ui> page, select <ui>Add Batch</ui> to launch a wizard.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Batch details</embeddedLabel> page, enter a batch name and a batch description, and then select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Batch details</embeddedLabel> page, enter a batch name and a batch description, and then select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Batch criteria</ui> page, enter the criteria based on which a batch configuration is triggered.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Batch criteria</ui> page, enter the criteria based on which a batch configuration is triggered.

trans-unit.source: The batch criterion is specified using the values of the promoted properties at runtime.
trans-unit.target: The batch criterion is specified using the values of the promoted properties at runtime.

trans-unit.source: You can either select the value from a grid to specify the batching condition or use a standard SQL 92 syntax to define the batching condition.
trans-unit.target: You can either select the value from a grid to specify the batching condition or use a standard SQL 92 syntax to define the batching condition.

trans-unit.source: To understand this better, let us assume you promoted a property (P1) whose value is set to ‘100’ at runtime.
trans-unit.target: To understand this better, let us assume you promoted a property (P1) whose value is set to ‘100’ at runtime.

trans-unit.source: To use this property as a condition for triggering a batch, you can do either of the following:
trans-unit.target: To use this property as a condition for triggering a batch, you can do either of the following:

trans-unit.source: Select the option for the grid, and then select the (<embeddedLabel>+</embeddedLabel>) icon to select the property you promoted.
trans-unit.target: Select the option for the grid, and then select the (<embeddedLabel>+</embeddedLabel>) icon to select the property you promoted.

trans-unit.source: From the grid, select <embeddedLabel>P1</embeddedLabel>, specify the <embeddedLabel>Operation</embeddedLabel> as (<embeddedLabel>==</embeddedLabel>), and set the value to <userInput>100</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: From the grid, select <embeddedLabel>P1</embeddedLabel>, specify the <embeddedLabel>Operation</embeddedLabel> as (<embeddedLabel>==</embeddedLabel>), and set the value to <userInput>100</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: OR
trans-unit.target: OR

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel> option, and specify a SQL 92 expression, such as:
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel> option, and specify a SQL 92 expression, such as:

trans-unit.source: You can use this option to provide more detailed query expressions using other operators as well.
trans-unit.target: You can use this option to provide more detailed query expressions using other operators as well.

trans-unit.source: In the example used here, during the agreement processing if a property P1 is created and its value is set to 100, then this batch is triggered.
trans-unit.target: In the example used here, during the agreement processing if a property P1 is created and its value is set to 100, then this batch is triggered.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Batch release criteria</embeddedLabel> page, specify the criteria for batching messages together.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Batch release criteria</embeddedLabel> page, specify the criteria for batching messages together.

trans-unit.source: The drop-down lets you select more than one criterion for batching.
trans-unit.target: The drop-down lets you select more than one criterion for batching.

trans-unit.source: However there are four key criterion that can be used together to provide different combinations:
trans-unit.target: However there are four key criterion that can be used together to provide different combinations:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>InterchangeSizeBased</embeddedLabel> – For the <embeddedLabel>Size(max)</embeddedLabel> property, enter the number of characters to create and send a batch.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>InterchangeSizeBased</embeddedLabel> – For the <embeddedLabel>Size(max)</embeddedLabel> property, enter the number of characters to create and send a batch.

trans-unit.source: The agreement accumulates batching elements until the character count in those elements exceeds the specified character count.
trans-unit.target: The agreement accumulates batching elements until the character count in those elements exceeds the specified character count.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>MessageCountBased</embeddedLabel> – For the <embeddedLabel>Count</embeddedLabel> property, enter the number of messages that must be processed together as a batch.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>MessageCountBased</embeddedLabel> – For the <embeddedLabel>Count</embeddedLabel> property, enter the number of messages that must be processed together as a batch.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>ScheduleBased</embeddedLabel> – For this option, enter the following properties:
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>ScheduleBased</embeddedLabel> – For this option, enter the following properties:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Occurs</embeddedLabel> – Specifies the unit of measurement of time in terms of minutes, hours, days, or weeks.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Occurs</embeddedLabel> – Specifies the unit of measurement of time in terms of minutes, hours, days, or weeks.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>First release</embeddedLabel> – Specifies which day and at what time the first batch is released.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>First release</embeddedLabel> – Specifies which day and at what time the first batch is released.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Recurs every</embeddedLabel> – Specifies the frequency or recurrence, after the first occurrence.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Recurs every</embeddedLabel> – Specifies the frequency or recurrence, after the first occurrence.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you set this property to <userInput>2</userInput> and the <embeddedLabel>Occurs</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>Hourly</userInput>, then the messages are batched every 2 hours after the first release.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you set this property to <userInput>2</userInput> and the <embeddedLabel>Occurs</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>Hourly</userInput>, then the messages are batched every 2 hours after the first release.

trans-unit.source: There could be a variation of +/- 10 seconds while releasing batches based on these criteria.
trans-unit.target: There could be a variation of +/- 10 seconds while releasing batches based on these criteria.

trans-unit.source: Also, the time period starts when the first message is received by the bridge.
trans-unit.target: Also, the time period starts when the first message is received by the bridge.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>TimeoutBased</embeddedLabel> – This property specifies the timeout (in minutes) at which a batch is triggered, irrespective of whether any other criterion is met or not.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>TimeoutBased</embeddedLabel> – This property specifies the timeout (in minutes) at which a batch is triggered, irrespective of whether any other criterion is met or not.

trans-unit.source: This property is always used along with another property.
trans-unit.target: This property is always used along with another property.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you set the batch release criteria to <embeddedLabel>MessageSizeBased, TimeoutBased</embeddedLabel> and the values to <userInput>3</userInput> messages and <userInput>5</userInput> minutes respectively, then the agreement first waits to collect three messages to constitute a batch.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you set the batch release criteria to <embeddedLabel>MessageSizeBased, TimeoutBased</embeddedLabel> and the values to <userInput>3</userInput> messages and <userInput>5</userInput> minutes respectively, then the agreement first waits to collect three messages to constitute a batch.

trans-unit.source: If three messages do not arrive in 5 minutes, the agreement goes ahead and processes the batch with whatever number of messages that is available.
trans-unit.target: If three messages do not arrive in 5 minutes, the agreement goes ahead and processes the batch with whatever number of messages that is available.

trans-unit.source: Note that the timeout value is the idle time from the last released batch.
trans-unit.target: Note that the timeout value is the idle time from the last released batch.

trans-unit.source: For the first batch, this timeout is the idle time from the start of the batch.
trans-unit.target: For the first batch, this timeout is the idle time from the start of the batch.

trans-unit.source: There could be a variation of +/- 10 seconds while releasing batches based on these criteria.
trans-unit.target: There could be a variation of +/- 10 seconds while releasing batches based on these criteria.

trans-unit.source: Also, the time period starts when the first message is received by the bridge.
trans-unit.target: Also, the time period starts when the first message is received by the bridge.

trans-unit.source: You can select different combinations of these key criterions to define when a batch is released.
trans-unit.target: You can select different combinations of these key criterions to define when a batch is released.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Summary</embeddedLabel> page, verify the batch configuration, and then select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Summary</embeddedLabel> page, verify the batch configuration, and then select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Certain points to consider regarding batches:
trans-unit.target: Certain points to consider regarding batches:

trans-unit.source: When you finish these steps, a batch is created.
trans-unit.target: When you finish these steps, a batch is created.

trans-unit.source: A batch is deployed only when you deploy the agreement containing the batch.
trans-unit.target: A batch is deployed only when you deploy the agreement containing the batch.

trans-unit.source: You cannot edit a batch when the agreement is deployed.
trans-unit.target: You cannot edit a batch when the agreement is deployed.

trans-unit.source: To edit a batch you must first stop the batch by selecting the <embeddedLabel>Stop Batch</embeddedLabel> link next to the batch.
trans-unit.target: To edit a batch you must first stop the batch by selecting the <embeddedLabel>Stop Batch</embeddedLabel> link next to the batch.

trans-unit.source: Once you finish editing a batch, you must redeploy the agreement to ensure that the updated batch configuration is used for further batch processing.
trans-unit.target: Once you finish editing a batch, you must redeploy the agreement to ensure that the updated batch configuration is used for further batch processing.

trans-unit.source: If you are redeploying an agreement, you do not need to stop the batches associated with it.
trans-unit.target: If you are redeploying an agreement, you do not need to stop the batches associated with it.

trans-unit.source: However, you must ensure that the changes that are made to the agreement do not affect the running batches.
trans-unit.target: However, you must ensure that the changes that are made to the agreement do not affect the running batches.

trans-unit.source: For example, if an agreement is updated to not process a purchase order schema (850), then you must ensure that none of the running batches are processing an 850 message at that point in time.
trans-unit.target: For example, if an agreement is updated to not process a purchase order schema (850), then you must ensure that none of the running batches are processing an 850 message at that point in time.

trans-unit.source: If such batches are not stopped, then the messages are suspended when the batch is released.
trans-unit.target: If such batches are not stopped, then the messages are suspended when the batch is released.

trans-unit.source: Before you delete an agreement, you must stop any batches associated with the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Before you delete an agreement, you must stop any batches associated with the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Add the Protocol settings
trans-unit.target: Add the Protocol settings

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Protocol</ui> page of the <ui>Send Settings</ui> tab allows you to enter the protocol settings between the two partners.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Protocol</ui> page of the <ui>Send Settings</ui> tab allows you to enter the protocol settings between the two partners.

trans-unit.source: These settings are used to create an X12 message before it is sent to the guest partner.
trans-unit.target: These settings are used to create an X12 message before it is sent to the guest partner.

trans-unit.source: These can be divided into Basic and Advanced Settings.
trans-unit.target: These can be divided into Basic and Advanced Settings.

trans-unit.source: Basic Settings
trans-unit.target: Basic Settings

trans-unit.source: Identifiers
trans-unit.target: Identifiers

trans-unit.source: Authorization qualifier (ISA1)
trans-unit.target: Authorization qualifier (ISA1)

trans-unit.source: Select the Authorization qualifier value from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Select the Authorization qualifier value from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: ISA2
trans-unit.target: ISA2

trans-unit.source: Enter Authorization information value.
trans-unit.target: Enter Authorization information value.

trans-unit.source: If this value is other than 00, then enter a minimum of one alphanumeric character and a maximum of 10.
trans-unit.target: If this value is other than 00, then enter a minimum of one alphanumeric character and a maximum of 10.

trans-unit.source: Security qualifier (ISA3)
trans-unit.target: Security qualifier (ISA3)

trans-unit.source: Select the Security qualifier value from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Select the Security qualifier value from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: ISA4
trans-unit.target: ISA4

trans-unit.source: Enter the Security information value.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Security information value.

trans-unit.source: If this value is other than 00, for the Value (ISA4) text box, then enter a minimum of one alphanumeric value and a maximum of 10.
trans-unit.target: If this value is other than 00, for the Value (ISA4) text box, then enter a minimum of one alphanumeric value and a maximum of 10.

trans-unit.source: Acknowledgements
trans-unit.target: Acknowledgements

trans-unit.source: TA1 expected
trans-unit.target: TA1 expected

trans-unit.source: Select this checkbox to return a technical (TA1) acknowledgment to the interchange sender.
trans-unit.target: Select this checkbox to return a technical (TA1) acknowledgment to the interchange sender.

trans-unit.source: This setting specifies that the host partner who is sending the message requests an acknowledgement from the guest partner in the agreement.
trans-unit.target: This setting specifies that the host partner who is sending the message requests an acknowledgement from the guest partner in the agreement.

trans-unit.source: These acknowledgments are expected by the host partner based on the Receive Settings of the agreement.
trans-unit.target: These acknowledgments are expected by the host partner based on the Receive Settings of the agreement.

trans-unit.source: FA expected
trans-unit.target: FA expected

trans-unit.source: Select this checkbox to return a functional (FA) acknowledgment to the interchange sender, and then select whether you want the 997 or 999 acknowledgements, based on the schema versions you are working with.
trans-unit.target: Select this checkbox to return a functional (FA) acknowledgment to the interchange sender, and then select whether you want the 997 or 999 acknowledgements, based on the schema versions you are working with.

trans-unit.source: These acknowledgments are expected by the host partner based on the Receive Settings of the agreement.
trans-unit.target: These acknowledgments are expected by the host partner based on the Receive Settings of the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Schemas
trans-unit.target: Schemas

trans-unit.source: Choose a schema to determine how the <token>tpm_portal</token> converts the XML message to EDI/ X12.
trans-unit.target: Choose a schema to determine how the <token>tpm_portal</token> converts the XML message to EDI/ X12.

trans-unit.source: The Send pipeline assembles the outgoing message by matching the values of GS and ST segments specified in this page with the GS and ST values in the message and the schema specified in this page with the schema of the XML message.
trans-unit.target: The Send pipeline assembles the outgoing message by matching the values of GS and ST segments specified in this page with the GS and ST values in the message and the schema specified in this page with the schema of the XML message.

trans-unit.source: To upload a schema:
trans-unit.target: To upload a schema:

trans-unit.source: Select the <ui>Upload</ui> button.
trans-unit.target: Select the <ui>Upload</ui> button.

trans-unit.source: In the Open dialog box, select the schema to use in the agreement, and select <ui>Open</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the Open dialog box, select the schema to use in the agreement, and select <ui>Open</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Common B2B schemas are available for download at <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=235057</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=235057</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: Common B2B schemas are available for download at <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=235057</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=235057</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: Once the schema is uploaded, you can specify the ST1 and Version details.
trans-unit.target: Once the schema is uploaded, you can specify the ST1 and Version details.

trans-unit.source: The Send bridge uses these settings to assemble any message that conforms to the selected schema.
trans-unit.target: The Send bridge uses these settings to assemble any message that conforms to the selected schema.

trans-unit.source: Advanced Settings
trans-unit.target: Advanced Settings

trans-unit.source: Envelopes
trans-unit.target: Envelopes

trans-unit.source: ISA11 Usage
trans-unit.target: ISA11 Usage

trans-unit.source: Use this field to specify the separator in a transaction set:
trans-unit.target: Use this field to specify the separator in a transaction set:

trans-unit.source: Select the Standard identifier to use the decimal notation of “.”
trans-unit.target: Select the Standard identifier to use the decimal notation of “.”

trans-unit.source: instead of the decimal notation of the incoming document in the EDI receive pipeline.
trans-unit.target: instead of the decimal notation of the incoming document in the EDI receive pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Select Repetition separator to specify the separator for repeated occurrences of a simple data element or a repeated data structure.
trans-unit.target: Select Repetition separator to specify the separator for repeated occurrences of a simple data element or a repeated data structure.

trans-unit.source: For example, (^) is usually used as repetition separator.
trans-unit.target: For example, (^) is usually used as repetition separator.

trans-unit.source: For HIPAA schemas, you can only use (^).
trans-unit.target: For HIPAA schemas, you can only use (^).

trans-unit.source: Control Version Number (ISA12)
trans-unit.target: Control Version Number (ISA12)

trans-unit.source: Select the version of the X12 standard that is used by the <token>tpm_portal</token> for generating an outgoing interchange.
trans-unit.target: Select the version of the X12 standard that is used by the <token>tpm_portal</token> for generating an outgoing interchange.

trans-unit.source: Usage Indicator (ISA15)
trans-unit.target: Usage Indicator (ISA15)

trans-unit.source: Enter whether the context of an interchange is information (I), production data (P), or test data (T).
trans-unit.target: Enter whether the context of an interchange is information (I), production data (P), or test data (T).

trans-unit.source: The EDI receive pipeline promotes this property to the context.
trans-unit.target: The EDI receive pipeline promotes this property to the context.

trans-unit.source: Schema
trans-unit.target: Schema

trans-unit.source: You can enter how the <token>tpm_portal</token> generates the GS and ST segments for an X12-encoded interchange that it sends to the Send Pipeline.
trans-unit.target: You can enter how the <token>tpm_portal</token> generates the GS and ST segments for an X12-encoded interchange that it sends to the Send Pipeline.

trans-unit.source: You can associate values of the GS1, GS2, GS3, GS4, GS5, GS7, and GS8 data elements with values of the Transaction Type, and Version/Release data elements.
trans-unit.target: You can associate values of the GS1, GS2, GS3, GS4, GS5, GS7, and GS8 data elements with values of the Transaction Type, and Version/Release data elements.

trans-unit.source: When the <token>tpm_portal</token> determines that an XML message has the values set for the Transaction Type, and Version/Release elements in a row of the grid, then it populates the GS1, GS2, GS3, GS4, GS5, GS7, and GS8 data elements in the envelope of the outgoing interchange with the values from the same row of the grid.
trans-unit.target: When the <token>tpm_portal</token> determines that an XML message has the values set for the Transaction Type, and Version/Release elements in a row of the grid, then it populates the GS1, GS2, GS3, GS4, GS5, GS7, and GS8 data elements in the envelope of the outgoing interchange with the values from the same row of the grid.

trans-unit.source: The values of the Transaction Type, and Version/Release elements must be unique.
trans-unit.target: The values of the Transaction Type, and Version/Release elements must be unique.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: For GS1, select a value for the functional code from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: For GS1, select a value for the functional code from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: For GS2, enter an alphanumeric value for the application sender with a minimum of two characters and a maximum of 15 characters.
trans-unit.target: For GS2, enter an alphanumeric value for the application sender with a minimum of two characters and a maximum of 15 characters.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: For GS3, enter an alphanumeric value for the application receiver with a minimum of two characters and a maximum of 15 characters.
trans-unit.target: For GS3, enter an alphanumeric value for the application receiver with a minimum of two characters and a maximum of 15 characters.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: For GS4, select CCYYMMDD or YYMMDD.
trans-unit.target: For GS4, select CCYYMMDD or YYMMDD.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: For GS5, select HHMM, HHMMSS, or HHMMSSdd.
trans-unit.target: For GS5, select HHMM, HHMMSS, or HHMMSSdd.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: For GS7, select a value for the responsible agency from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: For GS7, select a value for the responsible agency from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: For GS8, enter an alphanumeric value for the document identified with a minimum of one character and a maximum of 12 characters.
trans-unit.target: For GS8, enter an alphanumeric value for the document identified with a minimum of one character and a maximum of 12 characters.

trans-unit.source: These are the values that the <token>tpm_portal</token> enters in the GS fields of the interchange it is building if the Transaction Type, and Version/Release elements in the same row are a match for those associated with the interchange.
trans-unit.target: These are the values that the <token>tpm_portal</token> enters in the GS fields of the interchange it is building if the Transaction Type, and Version/Release elements in the same row are a match for those associated with the interchange.

trans-unit.source: Character Set and Separators
trans-unit.target: Character Set and Separators

trans-unit.source: Other than the character set, you can enter a different set of delimiters to be used for each message type.
trans-unit.target: Other than the character set, you can enter a different set of delimiters to be used for each message type.

trans-unit.source: If a character set is not specified for a given message schema, then the default character set is used.
trans-unit.target: If a character set is not specified for a given message schema, then the default character set is used.

trans-unit.source: Character Set to be used
trans-unit.target: Character Set to be used

trans-unit.source: Select the X12 character set to validate the properties that you enter for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Select the X12 character set to validate the properties that you enter for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: The <token>tpm_portal</token> only uses this setting to validate the values entered for the related agreement properties.
trans-unit.target: The <token>tpm_portal</token> only uses this setting to validate the values entered for the related agreement properties.

trans-unit.source: The receive pipeline or send pipeline ignores this character-set property when performing run-time processing.
trans-unit.target: The receive pipeline or send pipeline ignores this character-set property when performing run-time processing.

trans-unit.source: Schema
trans-unit.target: Schema

trans-unit.source: Select the (+) symbol and select a schema from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Select the (+) symbol and select a schema from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: For the selected schema, select the separators set to be used:
trans-unit.target: For the selected schema, select the separators set to be used:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Component element separator</embeddedLabel> – Enter a single character to separate composite data elements.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Component element separator</embeddedLabel> – Enter a single character to separate composite data elements.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Data Element Separator</embeddedLabel> – Enter a single character to separate simple data elements within composite data elements.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Data Element Separator</embeddedLabel> – Enter a single character to separate simple data elements within composite data elements.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Replacement Character</embeddedLabel> – Select this check box if the payload data contains characters that are also used as data, segment, or component separators.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Replacement Character</embeddedLabel> – Select this check box if the payload data contains characters that are also used as data, segment, or component separators.

trans-unit.source: You can then enter a replacement character.
trans-unit.target: You can then enter a replacement character.

trans-unit.source: When generating the outbound X12 message, all instances of separator characters in the payload data are replaced with the specified character.
trans-unit.target: When generating the outbound X12 message, all instances of separator characters in the payload data are replaced with the specified character.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Segment Terminator</embeddedLabel> – Enter a single character to indicate the end of an EDI segment.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Segment Terminator</embeddedLabel> – Enter a single character to indicate the end of an EDI segment.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Suffix</embeddedLabel> – Select the character that is used with the segment identifier.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Suffix</embeddedLabel> – Select the character that is used with the segment identifier.

trans-unit.source: If you designate a suffix, then the segment terminator data element can be empty.
trans-unit.target: If you designate a suffix, then the segment terminator data element can be empty.

trans-unit.source: If the segment terminator is left empty, then you must designate a suffix.
trans-unit.target: If the segment terminator is left empty, then you must designate a suffix.

trans-unit.source: Control Numbers
trans-unit.target: Control Numbers

trans-unit.source: Interchange Control Number (ISA13)
trans-unit.target: Interchange Control Number (ISA13)

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Enter a range of values for the interchange control number used by the <token>tpm_portal</token> in generating an outgoing interchange.
trans-unit.target: Enter a range of values for the interchange control number used by the <token>tpm_portal</token> in generating an outgoing interchange.

trans-unit.source: Enter a numeric value with a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 999999999.
trans-unit.target: Enter a numeric value with a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 999999999.

trans-unit.source: Group Control Number (GS06)
trans-unit.target: Group Control Number (GS06)

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Enter the range of numbers that the <token>tpm_portal</token> should use for the group control number.
trans-unit.target: Enter the range of numbers that the <token>tpm_portal</token> should use for the group control number.

trans-unit.source: Enter a numeric value with a minimum of one character and a maximum of nine characters.
trans-unit.target: Enter a numeric value with a minimum of one character and a maximum of nine characters.

trans-unit.source: Transaction Set Control Number (ST02)
trans-unit.target: Transaction Set Control Number (ST02)

trans-unit.source: For Transaction Set Control number (ST02), enter a range of numeric values for the required middle fields, and alphanumeric values for the optional prefix and suffix.
trans-unit.target: For Transaction Set Control number (ST02), enter a range of numeric values for the required middle fields, and alphanumeric values for the optional prefix and suffix.

trans-unit.source: The maximum length of all four fields is nine characters.
trans-unit.target: The maximum length of all four fields is nine characters.

trans-unit.source: Prefix
trans-unit.target: Prefix

trans-unit.source: To designate the range of transaction set control numbers used in an acknowledgment, enter values in the ACK Control number (ST02) fields.
trans-unit.target: To designate the range of transaction set control numbers used in an acknowledgment, enter values in the ACK Control number (ST02) fields.

trans-unit.source: Enter a numeric value for the middle two fields, and an alphanumeric value (if desired) for the prefix and suffix fields.
trans-unit.target: Enter a numeric value for the middle two fields, and an alphanumeric value (if desired) for the prefix and suffix fields.

trans-unit.source: The middle fields are required and contain the minimum and maximum values for the control number; the prefix and suffix are optional.
trans-unit.target: The middle fields are required and contain the minimum and maximum values for the control number; the prefix and suffix are optional.

trans-unit.source: The maximum length for all three fields is nine characters.
trans-unit.target: The maximum length for all three fields is nine characters.

trans-unit.source: Suffix
trans-unit.target: Suffix

trans-unit.source: To designate the range of transaction set control numbers used in an acknowledgment, enter values in the ACK Control number (ST02) fields.
trans-unit.target: To designate the range of transaction set control numbers used in an acknowledgment, enter values in the ACK Control number (ST02) fields.

trans-unit.source: Enter a numeric value for the middle two fields, and an alphanumeric value (if desired) for the prefix and suffix fields.
trans-unit.target: Enter a numeric value for the middle two fields, and an alphanumeric value (if desired) for the prefix and suffix fields.

trans-unit.source: The middle fields are required and contain the minimum and maximum values for the control number; the prefix and suffix are optional.
trans-unit.target: The middle fields are required and contain the minimum and maximum values for the control number; the prefix and suffix are optional.

trans-unit.source: The maximum length for all three fields is nine characters.
trans-unit.target: The maximum length for all three fields is nine characters.

trans-unit.source: Validation
trans-unit.target: Validation

trans-unit.source: EDI Validation
trans-unit.target: EDI Validation

trans-unit.source: Selecting this option enables validation on the interchange receiver.
trans-unit.target: Selecting this option enables validation on the interchange receiver.

trans-unit.source: This validation performs EDI validation on transaction-set data elements, validating data types, length restrictions, and empty data elements and training separators.
trans-unit.target: This validation performs EDI validation on transaction-set data elements, validating data types, length restrictions, and empty data elements and training separators.

trans-unit.source: Extended Validation
trans-unit.target: Extended Validation

trans-unit.source: Selecting this option enables extended validation of interchanges received from the interchange sender.
trans-unit.target: Selecting this option enables extended validation of interchanges received from the interchange sender.

trans-unit.source: This includes validation of field length, optionality, and repeat count in addition to XSD data type validation.
trans-unit.target: This includes validation of field length, optionality, and repeat count in addition to XSD data type validation.

trans-unit.source: You can enable extension validation without enabling EDI validation, or vice versa.
trans-unit.target: You can enable extension validation without enabling EDI validation, or vice versa.

trans-unit.source: Allow leading/ trailing zeroes
trans-unit.target: Allow leading/ trailing zeroes

trans-unit.source: Selecting this option specifies that an EDI interchange received from the party does not fail validation if a data element in an EDI interchange does not conform to its length requirement because of or trailing spaces, but does conform to its length requirement when they are removed.
trans-unit.target: Selecting this option specifies that an EDI interchange received from the party does not fail validation if a data element in an EDI interchange does not conform to its length requirement because of or trailing spaces, but does conform to its length requirement when they are removed.

trans-unit.source: Trailing separator
trans-unit.target: Trailing separator

trans-unit.source: Selecting this option specifies an EDI interchange received from the party does not fail validation if a data element in an EDI interchange does not conform to its length requirement because of leading (or trailing) zeroes or trailing spaces, but does conform to its length requirement when they are removed.
trans-unit.target: Selecting this option specifies an EDI interchange received from the party does not fail validation if a data element in an EDI interchange does not conform to its length requirement because of leading (or trailing) zeroes or trailing spaces, but does conform to its length requirement when they are removed.

trans-unit.source: Select Not Allowed if you do not want to allow trailing delimiters and separators in an interchange received from the interchange sender.
trans-unit.target: Select Not Allowed if you do not want to allow trailing delimiters and separators in an interchange received from the interchange sender.

trans-unit.source: If the interchange contains trailing delimiters and separators, it is declared invalid.
trans-unit.target: If the interchange contains trailing delimiters and separators, it is declared invalid.

trans-unit.source: Select Optional to accept interchanges with or without trailing delimiters and separators.
trans-unit.target: Select Optional to accept interchanges with or without trailing delimiters and separators.

trans-unit.source: Select Mandatory if the received interchange must contain trailing delimiters and separators.
trans-unit.target: Select Mandatory if the received interchange must contain trailing delimiters and separators.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Known Issue
trans-unit.target: Known Issue

trans-unit.source: The <token>tpm_portal</token> allows you to modify the Qualifier of an Identity when an agreement is configured.
trans-unit.target: The <token>tpm_portal</token> allows you to modify the Qualifier of an Identity when an agreement is configured.

trans-unit.source: This can result in inconsistence properties.
trans-unit.target: This can result in inconsistence properties.

trans-unit.source: For example, there is an agreement using ZZ:1234567 and ZZ:7654321 as the Qualifier.
trans-unit.target: For example, there is an agreement using ZZ:1234567 and ZZ:7654321 as the Qualifier.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> profile settings, you change ZZ:1234567 to be 01:<legacyItalic>ChangedValue</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> profile settings, you change ZZ:1234567 to be 01:<legacyItalic>ChangedValue</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: You open the agreement and 01:<legacyItalic>ChangedValue</legacyItalic> is displayed instead of ZZ:1234567.
trans-unit.target: You open the agreement and 01:<legacyItalic>ChangedValue</legacyItalic> is displayed instead of ZZ:1234567.

trans-unit.source: To modify the Qualifier of an identity, delete the agreement, update <ui>Identities</ui> in the partner profile, and then recreate the agreement.
trans-unit.target: To modify the Qualifier of an identity, delete the agreement, update <ui>Identities</ui> in the partner profile, and then recreate the agreement.
